N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 552.4 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Abuse means
practices that are inconsistent with sound fiscal, business, medical or
professional practices and which result in unnecessary costs to the program, payments for services which were not necessary, or payments for services which
fail to meet recognized standards for mental health care. (b) Audit means a review and evaluation of a
facility, program or unit by an objective and independent individual or team to
determine whether or not resources and/or funds are being utilized in an
appropriate and effective manner or to determine whether or not the expected
results established by the Office of Mental Health, control agencies, the

Legislature or other identified standard setting bodies are being
achieved. (c) Fraud means an
intentional deception or misrepresentation made with the knowledge that the
deception could result in an unauthorized benefit to the provider or another
person and includes the acts prohibited by section
366-b
of
the Social Services Law. (d) Provider of service means the entity which is responsible for the operation of
the facility or program. Such entity may be an individual, partnership, association or corporation. For purposes of this Part the term also applies to
a psychiatric center, facility or program operated by the Office of Mental

Health. Notes
